sense.name: an emotional outburst
sense.examples: Sally threw a fit when she heard Mary had been promoted above her. The child sat down on the floor in the restaurant and had a crying fit. He burned his old love letters in a fit of anger. The comedian's routine brought fits of laughter from the audience.

sense.name: a physical convulsion, sudden attack
sense.examples: John complained to the doctor about his coughing fits. The patient tried to swallow his tongue during an epileptic fit. With no warning the man fell to the ground, gasping in a fit.

sense.name: the way something conforms to a shape
sense.examples: These shoes are not a good fit, I'll try the smaller size. Mary liked the fit of the evening gown. The shelf was a perfect fit in the back of the closet. It'll be a close fit to get all the leftover stew into this container.

sense.name: how things match or correlate, especially data
sense.examples: This job is an excellent fit for Sally's skills and work experience. These data don't fit the climate computer model very well. The close fit of John's experimental results to an exponential curve is interesting.

sense.name: a flurry or burst of activity
sense.examples: We readied the house for sale in a fit of cleaning and repairs. The project is moving along in fits and starts. (lots of work sometimes) There was a fit of activity in the bride's dressing room before the wedding.
